body: This looks like a network failure. You can see near the top of that error output that it fails to download a file, and you can verify manually that that file does actually exist. The environment you are installing on may be causing some problems with outgoing network connections, maybe specifically to Google Cloud Storage.

@murgatroid99 Thanks for the response -- I don't think the issue is with the network/outgoing connections, as if I run `wget https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.7.2/node-v51-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz` in the same environment, it downloads fine. 

Any other ideas by chance?
Temporary solution for this is to upload the grpc npm package to our Github repo to use with Circleci, but would prefer not to do this.

Also having this issue. @StefanStokic - are any other steps required for beside including in the repo? Would really appreciate some tips....[update] nm. realized you just meant commit the `node_modules/grpc`. worked like magic. thanks

Experiencing this as well with a slightly different version combination, but otherwise all behaviour identical.
```
node-pre-gyp ERR! Tried to download(undefined): https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz 
```  


Checking in the node_modules/grpc directory did not make any difference in my case.
Bump. Same issue here. Oddly, `npm install` as a `circleci` build step seems to install just fine. When attempting to build my docker image, however, it fails as described.

To add on, it's worth noting that setting the logging level to verbose shows that the error does not appear to be network related.

```
> grpc@1.8.0 install /usr/src/app/node_modules/grpc
> node-pre-gyp install --fallback-to-build --library=static_library

node-pre-gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
node-pre-gyp verb cli [ '/usr/local/bin/node',
node-pre-gyp verb cli   '/usr/src/app/node_modules/grpc/node_modules/.bin/node-pre-gyp',
node-pre-gyp verb cli   'install',
node-pre-gyp verb cli   '--fallback-to-build',
node-pre-gyp verb cli   '--library=static_library' ]
node-pre-gyp info using node-pre-gyp@0.6.39
node-pre-gyp info using node@6.12.2 | linux | x64
node-pre-gyp verb command install []
node-pre-gyp info check checked for "/usr/src/app/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc/grpc_node.node" (not found)  
node-pre-gyp http GET https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp http 200 https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp info install unpacking grpc_node.node
node-pre-gyp ERR! Tried to download(undefined): https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz 
```
There's clearly a 200 response code from the download attempt and it tries to unpack the download which is what appears to crash.

For comparison, some logs from an earlier build that were still succeeding 

```
node-pre-gyp http GET https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.6.6/node-v48-linux-x64.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp http 200 https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.6.6/node-v48-linux-x64.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp info install unpacking grpc_node.node
node-pre-gyp info tarball done parsing tarball
[grpc] Success: "/usr/src/app/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/node-v48-linux-x64/grpc_node.node" is installed via remote
```

Hi, I have the same issue. @kulinsj @kulinsj. but I switch to the china mirror (https://registry.npm.taobao.org)
work for me. 
**`$ npm install -g cnpm --registry=https://registry.npm.taobao.org`**

`PS D:\Git\www> cnpm install grpc
√ Installed 1 packages
√ Linked 36 latest versions
node-pre-gyp http GET https://npm.taobao.org/mirrors/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v57-win32-x64-unknown.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp http 200 https://npm.taobao.org/mirrors/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v57-win32-x64-unknown.tar.gz
[grpc] Success: "D:\Git\www\node_modules\_grpc@1.8.0@grpc\src\node\extension_binary\node-v57-win32-x64-unknown\grpc_node.node" is installed via remote
√ Run 1 scripts
Recently updated (since 2017-12-14): 1 packages (detail see file D:\Git\www\node_modules\.recently_updates.txt)
√ All packages installed (37 packages installed from npm registry, used 4s, speed 20.27kB/s, json 37(71.35kB), tarball 0B)`

Hi @seamys, unfortunately, this didn't change the error for me. The download was fine (http 200), but again, unpacking the successfully downloaded files is what fails.

```
node-pre-gyp http GET https://npm.taobao.org/mirrors/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp http 200 https://npm.taobao.org/mirrors/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp ERR! Tried to download(undefined): https://npm.taobao.org/mirrors/grpc/v1.8.0/node-v48-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz 
node-pre-gyp ERR! Pre-built binaries not found for grpc@1.8.0 and node@6.12.2 (node-v48 ABI, glibc) (falling back to source compile with node-gyp) 
```
Same problem here when trying to install google cloud functions emulator..
In my case was the network Firewall. I'll kill the network manager.
I have published version 1.8.4 of the Node gRPC package. It includes some changes that may fix this problem. Can you try that out and see if it works?

On the network that was blockin still blocking. To prove that simple access
google material guidelines and see if images and videos are visible,
because is storage.googleapis.com that are blocked in my network for some
reason.

My luck is that i did use other nerwork close to me to install this.

Thank you.

You're right. I did not expect my change to affect network problems. Rather, the initial errors reported in this file seem to be failing when unpacking the file, not when downloading it. That is the problem that I think is solved.

Still got the same set of errors for 1.8.4 (installation is being run with `sudo`)
```
node-pre-gyp ERR! Tried to download(undefined): https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.8.4/node-v57-darwin-x64-unknown.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp ERR! Pre-built binaries not found for grpc@1.8.4 and node@8.9.3 (node-v57 ABI, unknown) (falling back to source compile with node-gyp)

gyp ERR! configure error
gyp ERR! stack Error: EACCES: permission denied, mkdir '/usr/local/lib/node_modules/grpc/build'
gyp ERR! System Darwin 17.3.0
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/bin/node" "/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "configure" "--fallback-to-build" "--library=static_library" "--module=/usr/local/lib/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/node-v57-darwin-x64-unknown/grpc_node.node" "--module_name=grpc_node" "--module_path=/usr/local/lib/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/node-v57-darwin-x64-unknown"
gyp ERR! cwd /usr/local/lib/node_modules/grpc
gyp ERR! node -v v8.9.3
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v3.6.2
gyp ERR! not ok
```

Please, check your network. An easy test to access the "Material
Guidelines" web site and see if images and videos are been charged.

`npm -v` gives me 5.6.0
Link downloads in the browser with no issues

Npm version is 4.6.1 to me.

1 - Ensure that you are executing terminal in adm mode (If your project
folder are in protected path).
2 - Try to install npm 4.6.x.
3 - Try to delete node_modules folder and type npm install again.

They are 3 actions that made this work to me in other moments.

Can you try this?

Did you find some solution @AAverin ? I'm with the same problem too. On Windows when I turn off the firewall all works, but on Mac don't work!

Having these same problems with the install on Ubuntu. File downloads fine with wget, but install fails saying it can't get the file https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.9.1/node-v57-linux-x64-glibc.tar.gz

Run "npm install grpc --save" before npm install 
OR
Delete node_modules folder and package-lock.json file then start with above line will fix the issue.
@arifsami03 This is not working, still same errors.
